subject: redfish: Add Chassis associated Drive query
commitMessage:
redfish: Add Chassis associated Drive query

This change supports named drives being queried by their associated
chassis, by using the follow form:

/redfish/v1/Chassis/<chassis>/Drives/<drive>

This change is in accordance with redfish

Tested:
With the redfish validator: No new errors

$ wget -qO- http://localhost:80/redfish/v1/Chassis/DC_SCM/Drives/mmcblk0
{
  "@odata.context": "/redfish/v1/$metadata#Drive.Drive",
  "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/Chassis/DC_SCM/Drives/mmcblk0",
  "@odata.type": "#Drive.v1_7_0.Drive",
  "CapacityBytes": 15634268160,
  "Id": "mmcblk0",
  "Name": "mmcblk0",
  "Status": {
    "State": "Enabled"
  }
}

Signed-off-by: John Edward Broadbent <jebr@google.com>
Change-Id: I3501ea4789bae57a905052d0e820d441665b72d7

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as e56ed6b98104954444ba2ccb0681b1a174e24b00
How does this patch relate to https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/53563/3

This patch does 
"/redfish/v1/Chassis/<str>/Drives/<str>/"

The other patch does
(https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/53563/3)
"/redfish/v1/Chassis/<str>/Drives/"

?????

Please use urlFromPieces, which is intended for this use case of combining url pieces, and helps avoid this error.

What do you think the error is? Clang give an warning if the "+" is used, when the += would work.

```
error: string concatenation results in allocation of unnecessary temporary strings; consider using 'operator+=' or 'string::append()' instead [performance-inefficient-string-concatenation,-warnings-as-errors]
```
https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/42459/console

I can use urlFromPieces.
Please don't mix brace initialization with operator[] init.  Per the other patchset that in review, operator[] will be the only thing.
These calls are on different code paths.
Why do we need to do getSubTree twice?  We already did it on line 978?

The mapper is called on the chassis
then it is called on drive.

On line 911 we are calling drives
on line 978 we are calling chassis
nit, please take the word "Name" out of this function.  You're getting the "Drive" not the name.

"chassisDriveGet" is already a function name, used in the first patch.
I will change either name, if you have a recommendation.
Is this association name documented in phosphor-dbus-interfaces?
No, What are the actions we need to take to document this association in pdi?

That was very helpful.

this does not match https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/redfish-core/lib/storage.hpp#L487-L603 anymore.

Also, you should be refactoring that instead of having them be seperate. I am not sure if they differs that much.

Does synced mean rebased?

When you make links to a GH repository, please use a canonical url. Your URL uses what ever is on the master branch, which will soon change. The hot-key for canonical urls is 'y'

thanks.

I meant that we can combine the handler. I guess it is the same discussion in https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/53563/4..8/redfish-core/lib/chassis.hpp#b993.
should probably return after find one that is valid.

This would matter if you had two chassis with the same name. 
I am fine to break after the first match.
right, but why continue loop through the chassis when we don't need to. If there are two chassis with the same name and both are valid, there will be race condition on which info get set.

I added the break on patchset 5, so only the first matching chttps://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/53563/5/redfish-core/lib/storage.hpp#723


We can talk more about what would happen if I did not add the break if you want? 
(It is unclear to me if it would race)

? I added the file in question, do you want it in the function called 
"getDriveItemProperties"? That would not make any sense.
that should have been pointed to `requestRoutesDrive`. Anyway, they are both registering for Drives.

Please explain why you think this function should be in requestRoutesDrive, and not in it's own requestRoute? You might be right, but it is not obvious to me. 

Having more requestRoutes increases the configuration granularity. (makes it easier exclude specific handlers)  


Probably your link was good at some point in the past. Please use canonical URLS, with the GH hotkey "y"
I just thought that they will always be enabled anyway, so no reason to make it separate / configurable. But its whatever.
you need to make sure that your Drive dos not get pick up here again.

What do you mean by that?
This is a very standard usage of BMCWEB_ROUTE.

```
BMCWEB_ROUTE(app, "/redfish/v1/Systems/system/Storage/1/Drives/<str>/")
```

will pick up any Drives at the moment. So there will be two redfish endpoint pointing at the same Drive. Maybe that's fine. idk.

This is what I expect, you can get the same info by doing:
```
/redfish/v1/Systems/system/Storage/1/Drives/wltu_drive
```
and
```
/redfish/v1/Chassis/wltu_chassis/Drives/wltu_drive/"
```

Technical not the same endpoint, but yeah, the same information. This is compliant with redfish.

It doesn't really matter that it is compliant with redfish, It's more like if that's logically correct or not.

One it linked to the Computer system and one is link to a Chassis.

It is the same drive, but you can access it different paths. I think it is logically sound. Is there any aspect that is illogical/inconsistent/unclear 

(It matters to me that bmcweb be redfish compliant, but I understand it is not the only concern.)
+1.  I beleive willy is right here, the "Drive" should only show up in one spot in the tree.  If not, this will cause multiple devpaths to get created.

Can you please review the JBOF mockup published by DMTF linked below:
(https://redfish.dmtf.org/redfish/mockups/v1/1159)

There are two ways to navigate to the same drive, in the published use case. 
The same drive is linked in "chassis/1/Drives" and and"Storage/NVMeof"

Let me know your thoughts

We should ask DMTF, just looking at that mockup makes me think it's incorrect, because Storage::Drives is a Collection(Drive) with AutoExpandReferences set, but the mockup in question doesn't auto expand the drives query.

I created post on the redfish forum.
https://redfishforum.com/thread/667/drives-nvme-jbof-mockup-expanding
nit, just stick this in your tested section.

but this does work, so it might be fine for now.
